Our researchers lead the way in research of pediatric diseases including cancer, genetics, AIDS/HIV, and obesity.   We are a leading school of medicine for a broad spectrum of pediatric specialties. Our residents perform rotations in  emergency medicine ,  cardiology ,  critical care ,  hematology and oncology ,  neonatology ,  infectious diseases  and more.   We also offer  fellowships  and  summer research opportunities  for medical students preparing for a career in pediatric medicine.   To find a pediatric specialist for your child call toll-free 855.NYU.KIDS. Just by being a parent and a student, you have already proven that nothing is unreachable, and that you have great strength and determination. Below you will find a number of resources that may be helpful to you as you balance both these roles.   NYU Family Care   NYU Family Care is working to support NYU's working parents with children aged newborn through school-age. Many of the initiatives are also available to student parents. These include access to the NYU Babysitting Registry , Nursing Mother and Lactation Rooms , Parenting Education Programs, NYU Parents Network , and school and child care options. Students may also sign-up for the Monthly Family Cares News email, which includes information about activates, events, resources, and programs available at NYU and in NYC. Vist NYU Family Care at www.nyu.edu/family.care .     Upcoming Programs and Workshops   For a listing of NYU Family Care's upcoming programs and workshops please click here.             Referral Program                                           In addition to the resources available through NYU's Family Care program, the Student Resource Center can connect you with a number of useful resources through the University's relationship with the Carebridge Corporation.                               Carebridge offers Master's level consultants to assist NYU student-parents to:     Better understand your early education and school-age care options   Develop a childcare plan that works for you and your family   Understand what constitutes quality early childhood education and out-of-school care   Research and identify vacancies in the NYC-metropolitan area for regular full and part-time care for your child(ren) from newborn through school-age   Identify and select services for your children before and after school, during school holidays and vacation weeks   Establish a back-up care plan and identify options for emergency and sick child care   Personalized Consultation and Referrals     What consultants do:     Intitial phone consultation   Discuss your specific needs, questions and concerns   Help you to develop a plan to resolve your issues   Send you high quality educational materials that address your questions and help you make sound decisions   Provide referral for childcare for children infant through school-age   Conduct a personalized search for programs and services to meet your needs   Follow-up with you to determine if you have any additional questions or need other assistance     Unlimited Access   You may call upon the expertise of the program as many times as you need until your questions are answered or your problems are resolved. The information and referral services are provided by NYU at no cost to you, however, there may be fee associated with the services referred to you.   For questions, contact Carebridge at 800-437-0911 or email clientservice@carebridge.com. Pediatric Residency Program | Pediatric Residency Program                                 Skip to main content                      Patient Care       Faculty & Staff Directory       Events       Careers       Donate                                                                                                                                                                             Pediatric Residency Program                    DEPARTMENT OF PEDIATRICS                                                                                   Home   Program Overview   Meet the Residents   How to Apply   Resident Life   Contact Us                                  Home            Print  Email               - A + A                                                                                                                                           Pediatric Residency Program                                          The Department of Pediatrics currently offers trainees a three-year path to achieve broad clinical competency in general pediatrics (our Categorical Track) and a two-year combined pediatric neurology pathway with our Neurology Department (Pediatric Neurology Categorical Track).   We are committed to clinical training in both pathways emphasizing a well balanced, hands-on experience in pediatrics that prepares residents equally well for careers as pediatric generalists or pediatric subspecialists.   Our pediatric training program is fully accredited by the Accreditation Council for Graduate Medical Education.                                                             Program Overview                      Our mission is to prepare highly competent pediatricians for careers in either primary care or academic medicine. Our program leaders are listed here .         More                Resident Life                      Pediatric residents work hard learning the skills they will need to care for children, but there are many opportunities to enjoy themselves and their time in New York City.
